items.title: Activities just got an upgrade
items.content: Improved visibility of your recent, pending and currently running activities!

items.title: Email alerts will be sent on credit card expiration
items.content: Nobody wants a project to go offline because a credit card has expired. So as of 25 May, 2020 Platform.sh will automatically email project owners and billing contacts if your credit card will no longer be valid on the next billing cycle. That way, you can update your payment information to ensure continuity of service.

items.title: Activity Scripts
items.content: Or how to build your own Platform.sh features

steps.content:
Activity Scripts: or how to build your own Platform.sh features

Activity Scripts are custom pieces of JavaScript code that are added to your Platform.sh project via a single API call or CLI command. They live within your project, so there is no need to host it or run it anywhere else.

Check out our blog post or read the detailed specifications in our documentation.

Activity Scripts allow your Platform.sh projects to:

  • Interact with third-party services (Slack, Twilio, PagerDuty, Jira, you-name-it)
  • Automate complex tasks when an activity is triggered or has completed
  • Set up custom notifications, alerts, or reminders
  • Be compliant across your fleet of sites by ensuring that all your projects are using the latest supported services and runtimes
  • And so much more.

The only limit is your imagination.

Now that they’re available, what integration will you build?

Whatever you’re inspired to build, we hope you’ll share it with the Platform.sh community. Upload your own scripts, ideas, recipes, or browse existing ones, to the activity script section of our community site.

We can’t wait to see what you come up with!

items.title: Improving integrations visibility
items.content: This makes validating, testing, and troubleshooting an external integration so much easier.

steps.content:
Improve visibility over your external integrations

Platform.sh now supports displaying activities from your integrations in the API or command line.

This means that from now on, external integrations (GitHub, Gitlab, Slack, etc.) that you enable in your Platform.sh project will trigger activities every time that something happens with that integration.

Learn more in our blog post

items.content: By 29 April, 2020 we are introducing multiple changes to our infrastructure to improve the performance and security of our user management. We are also introducing support for Single Sign-On (SSO) for Enterprise and Elite tiers. Read more

items.title: Health notifications for all
items.content: As of 6 April, all new projects will have email notifications configured by default for all admin users on a project. No extra steps necessary; create a project and you’ll get health notifications. You’re still free to add more notification channels if you wish. Read how

items.title: Streamlined project creation
items.content: Get your projects started faster than ever before with just 3 simple steps

steps.content:
Streamline project creation

Our new, streamlined 3-step process speeds project creation, enabling you to work on your projects faster than ever before. All new projects will default to our smallest plan size; you can edit your plan to upgrade your project at any time.

To learn more about our latest console enhancements, check out our recent blog post or read more in our detailed documentation.

How project creation works

Select your project type

Create a new project, migrate an existing project or choose from one of our project templates to start your project.

Add your project details

Name and select the data center region for your project.

Apply a template, if you’d like

Choose from our large collection of language-specific, ready-to-use templates.

You’re ready to go

Your project is now built. Remember that all new projects will be created automatically on our smallest Development plan size; upgrade whenever you want to go live.

Get down to the work that matters, faster

Streamlining project creation means that you can quickly create projects, then upgrade or customize your plan size whenever you’re ready.

To learn more about what’s happening in the console, check out our recent blog posts (link: need link to feature announcement blog post)or read more in our detailed documentation.

items.title: New Services insights
items.content: Gain deeper service and app  information directly from your console.

steps.content:
New Services insights

In your Project Environment you'll now see a Services tab giving you more insight into your application, service, and route containers.

To learn more about our about the new services insights, check out our recent blog posts or read more in our detailed documentation.

How it works

Routes

View information about each route configured in your routes.yaml file.

App Overview

Size of the app container, the amount of persistent disk you have allocated for it, the number of active workers and cron jobs, as well as the command to ssh into that container.

App crons

View status, frequency, the last time it was run, and the run command.

App configuration

See the summary of your .platform.app.yaml file.

Services

See allocated disk space, container size and configuration information.

That’s all folks!

By introducing our new Services tab we aim to giving you more insight into your application, service, and route containers to help you better manage your projects.

To learn more about our about the new services insights, check out our recent blog posts or read more in our detailed documentation.

items.title: Welcome, Dark Mode
items.content: You can now work in our new Dark Mode on your Platform.sh console.

steps.content:
Welcome, Dark Mode

Have larger apps that require mega resources, whether they’re on production or development branches? No worries. Now there's a great option to increase the size of your dev containers.

To enable Dark Mode

  1. Open Account settings
  2. Select Color Scheme > Dark
  3. Save
  4. Work in the dark and look cool doing it!
